text:
I don’t see this happening, too many false positives to build out a system like this.

<@U03BA1PRV7S> you can have properties input into a custom code action, and I believe they show up there. So if you are trying to manipulate something, you could create a system where any property you manipulate in the custom code action, you use it as an input. You don’t even have to bring it into the code using `event.inputFields`
<@U25PYL3Q8> They don't show the workflows using the property in the inputs in the "used id" section. Otherwise your solution would be ideal.
I had to create an script to scan the workflows in the account to make sure the list of workflows using the property show up lol - the api will provide the whole source code + the inputs
YOU ARE CORRECT, I’m sorry I am wrong on this, Workflows only show up on the trigger items. You would need to add all items to the trigger for it to show up on workflows. Thanks for correcting me
Yes that would be a nice workaround, thanks for sharing!

Hi <@U05KNCMAE7N>, I tried out this component and loved how smooth it looks when trying it out while developing locally.

I got this issue when I tried to upload it into production as it seems `/<@UDA553DRD>/ui-extensions` is not exporting the component. Would you have any guidance of how to go from here?
Hey <@U07BFVCLGR4> could you let me know your portalId? The first thing I would try is deleting node_modules + package.lock and rerunning npm install + reuploading.

Hi! Has anyone else been experiencing unexpected loading of custom react cards? I have two cards in my project that are suddenly reloading constantly. I have not changed the build since yesterday but the unexpected behavior started about 15-20 minutes ago. Had to disable both card from team views because the rapid reloading is causing serverless errors.

<@U011PG2JL2H> sorry for the delayed response! We decided to save content in a custom contact property, then train the reps to use a template when they click the email action. See for example: <https://www.loom.com/share/ccd03444afb548a498e3c3830e02432b?sid=3aebd54b-b13a-4f2b-9b60-d2539017ec66>

Hi everyone, we're seeing an issue when users update a file property using the `onCrmPropertiesUpdate` function on the CRM extension. The property is updated with the file, but the page crashes with the error:
Error: You attempted to call a function that was already revoked. at handleCloseComplete.
It started happening today, I believe, across all properties that use the `onCrmPropertiesUpdate` from ui-extensions
<@U01NMMDTERZ> do you happen to know if this issue is specific to our extension?
<@U05KNCMAE7N> <@U03FJQPSC0Y> Guys do you know if this is happening to anyone else?
